benchmark_details.name: RTVLM (Red Teaming Visual Language Models)
benchmark_details.overview: RTVLM is the first red teaming dataset to benchmark current Visual Language Models (VLMs) in terms of four aspects: faithfulness, privacy, safety, and fairness. The dataset includes 10 sub-tasks under these aspects.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the robustness and vulnerabilities of Visual Language Models through a comprehensive red teaming methodology.

data.source: The RTVLM dataset comprises 5,200 samples collected from various sources including public domain images and diffusion-generated content.
data.annotation: Annotated by humans and generated by GPT-4 with self-instruct.

methodology.calculation: Evaluation based on scoring criteria established for each task aspect.
methodology.interpretation: Scores are assigned on a scale of 1-10 based on model output quality against established guidelines.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4V serves as the benchmark, demonstrating superior performance compared to other models tested.
methodology.validation: Performance of VLMs on RTVLM has been validated through both human evaluation and automated assessments.

targeted_risks.harm: The dataset aims to detect harmful content generation and ensure ethical model outputs.
